definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
lit. to carry firewood to put out a fire (idiom); fig. to make a problem worse by inappropriate action

sentences.english: John is a New York Dity firefighter.
sentences.chinese: 约翰是纽约市的一名救火员。

sentences.english: I heard the sound of a fire engine.
sentences.chinese: 我听到了救火车的声音。

sentences.english: The little boy thought he wanted to be a fireman when he grew up.
sentences.chinese: 那个小男孩想在长大后当一位救火员。

sentences.english: I put on the brake before the car knocked into the fire engine.
sentences.chinese: 我踏下了制动器才没有撞到救火车上。

sentences.english: The jet of water from the hose soon put out the fire.
sentences.chinese: 救火水管中射出的水很快就把火杀绝了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people are now fighting the fire.
sentences.chinese: 上百人现在正在参与救火的行动。

sentences.english: Did you see how the doctor's car raced up to the door? Just like a fire-engine .
sentences.chinese: 你看丁医生的汽车就像救火车，直冲到客厅前。

sentences.english: Have you got ready the fire hose and fire equipment for emergency ?
sentences.chinese: 你们的救火水龙带和救火设备是否预备好可紧急使用？

sentences.english: Have you got ready the fire hose and fire equipment for emergency ?
sentences.chinese: 你们的救火水龙带和救火设备是否预备好可紧急使用？

sentences.english: Fire-brigade will come immediately and put it out.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员马上就来救火。

sentences.english: The anti-fire brigade project started in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 救火队项目最早自1999年开始启动。

sentences.english: The fire had burnt(itself)out before the fire engines arrived.
sentences.chinese: 救火车到达之前，火就熄灭了。

sentences.english: A fireman collapsed from the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 一个救火员被浓烟熏倒了。

sentences.english: There are always fire-fighting activities and administrative tasks in every line of work.
sentences.chinese: 每一行业总是有一些紧急似救火的活动和行政任务。

sentences.english: F Wait at the nearby safety exit for the fire fighting team to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的安全出口等待救火队的到达。
肯定有人叫过救火车了啊。

definition: firefighting/to extinguish a fire and save life and property/to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
to catch fire/to cook/to get angry
to set on fire/to commit arson/to create a disturbance
